The History Of Computer Science

Key dates and moment in it's history!

FUN FACT!
What is a computer?

A computer is a machine that can follow a list of instructions to do math or make decisions all by itself. People make these lists of instructions, called programs, to help the computer do all sorts of things.

The Year 1931
First large-scale automatic computer!

At the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Vannevar Bush invents and builds the Differential Analyzer, the first large-scale automatic general-purpose mechanical analog computer, according to Stanford University.

1937
First electric-only computer!

John Vincent Atanasoff, a professor of physics and mathematics at Iowa State University, submits a grant proposal to build the first electric-only computer, without using gears, cams, belts or shafts.

1939
Hewlett-Packard's company

Two guys named David Packard and Bill Hewlett started a company called Hewlett-Packard in California. They couldn't decide what to call their company, so they flipped a coin to decide. They set up their first office in Packard's garage back in 1939 Click here for an image of their garage!

1953
Grace Hopper & Thomas Johnson Watason Jr.

Grace Hopper made a new way for people to talk to computers called COBOL. It stands for Common Business-Oriented Language. People still use it today! She was really important and even got called the "First Lady of Software" after she passed away. Click here for an image of Grace! Around the same time, a man named Thomas Johnson Watson Jr. had an idea to make a special computer to help keep track of things during the war in Korea. His idea became the IBM 701 EDPM

1970
The first DRAM chip

The newly formed Intel unveils the Intel 1103, the first Dynamic Access Memory (DRAM) chip Click here for an image of the Intel 1103!

1971
The Floppy Disks!

A team of IBM engineers led by Alan Shugart invents the "floppy disk," enabling data to be shared among different computers. This is like today's USB stick! Click here for an image of the different sized floppy disks!

1976
The Apple 1 gets unveiled!

Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak co-found Apple Computer on April Fool's Day. They unveil Apple I, the first computer with a single-circuit board and ROM (Read Only Memory), according to MIT. Click here for an image of the Apple 1!

1989
Websites!

Tim Berners-Lee, a British researcher at the European Organization for Nuclear Research, submits his proposal for what would become the World Wide Web. His paper details his ideas for Hyper Text Markup Language (HTML), basically the basis of a website!

1993
The first Pentium Processor!

The Pentium microprocessor advances the use of graphics and music on PCs. Click here for an image of the First Pentium Processor

1999
Wi-Fi, also known as the Internet!

Wi-Fi, the abbreviated term for "wireless fidelity" is developed, initially covering a distance of up to 300 feet (91 meters). This is what our day-to-day routers emit so that we can connect to the internet!

2001
Mac OS is releaseed, Apple's operating system!

Mac OS X, later renamed OS X then simply macOS, is released by Apple as the successor to its standard Mac Operating System. OS X goes through 16 different versions, each with "10" as its title, and the first nine iterations are nicknamed after big cats, with the first being codenamed "Cheetah‚Äù.

2004
Mozilla Launches Firefox!

The Mozilla Corporation launches Mozilla Firefox 1.0. The Web browser is one of the first major challenges to Internet Explorer, owned by Microsoft. During its first five years, Firefox exceeded a billion downloads by users, according to the Web Design Museum. Click here for an image of the Original Mozilla Firefox

2006
The First Macbook Pro from Apple!

The MacBook Pro from Apple hits the shelves. The Pro is the company's first Intel-based, dual-core mobile computer. Click here for an image of the first Macbook Pro

2010
Apple's Ipad hits the stores!

The iPad, Apple's flagship handheld tablet, is unveiled. Click here for an image of Steve Jobs(founder of apple) holding the iPad 1, the first flagship iPad released by Apple

After 2010
Google and Apple release new technology and software!

Google releases the Chromebook, which runs on Google Chrome OS, Apple releases the Apple Watch and Microsoft releases Windows 10.
